dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: ¿Cómo es tu nueva casa?
dialog.english: What is your new house like?

dialog.speaker: Mario
dialog.spanish: Es grande. Tiene un jardín y un balcón.
dialog.english: It's big. It has a garden and a balcony.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! Mi apartamento no tiene jardín. Solo tiene un balcón pequeño.
dialog.english: How nice! My apartment doesn't have a garden. It only has a small balcony.

dialog.speaker: Mario
dialog.spanish: ¿Cuántos dormitorios tiene?
dialog.english: How many bedrooms does it have?

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Tiene tres dormitorios. El pasillo es muy largo.
dialog.english: It has three bedrooms. The hallway is very long.

questions.question: ¿Cuántos dormitorios tiene el apartamento de Elena?

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: Mi casa está muy sucia. Tengo que barrer el suelo.
dialog.english: My house is very dirty. I have to sweep the floor.

dialog.speaker: Pablo
dialog.spanish: Yo tengo que pasar la aspiradora en la alfombra de la sala.
dialog.english: I have to vacuum the living room rug.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: ¿Y la ropa? ¿Lavas la ropa hoy?
dialog.english: And the clothes? Are you washing the clothes today?

dialog.speaker: Pablo
dialog.spanish: Sí, mi madre y yo lavamos la ropa y luego la tendemos en el balcón.
dialog.english: Yes, my mother and I wash the clothes and then we hang them on the balcony.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: Yo no tengo balcón. Tiendo la ropa en el jardín.
dialog.english: I don't have a balcony. I hang the clothes in the garden.

dialog.speaker: Andrés
dialog.spanish: ¿Qué hay en la sala de tu casa?
dialog.english: What is in the living room of your house?

dialog.speaker: Clara
dialog.spanish: Hay un sofá grande, una mesa pequeña y un cuadro en la pared.
dialog.english: There is a big sofa, a small table, and a painting on the wall.

dialog.speaker: Andrés
dialog.spanish: ¿Y en tu dormitorio? ¿Qué hay en tu dormitorio?
dialog.english: And in your bedroom? What is in your bedroom?

dialog.speaker: Clara
dialog.spanish: En mi dormitorio hay una cama, un escritorio y una lámpara.
dialog.english: In my bedroom there is a bed, a desk, and a lamp.

dialog.speaker: Andrés
dialog.spanish: ¿Usas el escritorio para trabajar?
dialog.english: Do you use the desk to work?

dialog.speaker: Clara
dialog.spanish: Sí, trabajo en el escritorio y a veces leo libros.
dialog.english: Yes, I work at the desk and sometimes I read books.

questions.question: ¿Qué hay en la sala de Clara?

dialog.speaker: Beatriz
dialog.spanish: Necesito cocinar, pero el horno no funciona.
dialog.english: I need to cook, but the oven is not working.

dialog.speaker: Jorge
dialog.spanish: Qué mal. ¿Y el lavaplatos funciona?
dialog.english: That's bad. And does the dishwasher work?

dialog.speaker: Beatriz
dialog.spanish: Sí, el lavaplatos funciona. Es muy útil.
dialog.english: Yes, the dishwasher works. It is very useful.

dialog.speaker: Jorge
dialog.spanish: ¿Qué vas a cocinar si el horno no funciona?
dialog.english: What are you going to cook if the oven is not working?

dialog.speaker: Beatriz
dialog.spanish: Voy a usar la estufa para hacer sopa.
dialog.english: I am going to use the stove to make soup.

questions.question: ¿Qué va a usar Beatriz para cocinar?

dialog.speaker: Daniela
dialog.spanish: ¿Qué estás haciendo en el jardín, Mateo?
dialog.english: What are you doing in the garden, Mateo?

dialog.speaker: Mateo
dialog.spanish: Estoy regando las plantas. Mi madre me ayuda.
dialog.english: I'm watering the plants. My mother helps me.

dialog.speaker: Daniela
dialog.spanish: Qué bien. Yo estoy en el balcón, leyendo un libro.
dialog.english: How nice. I am on the balcony, reading a book.

dialog.speaker: Mateo
dialog.spanish: ¿Y por la noche?
dialog.english: And at night?

dialog.speaker: Daniela
dialog.spanish: Por la noche, yo descanso en el sofá de la sala.
dialog.english: At night, I rest on the sofa in the living room.

questions.question: ¿Qué está haciendo Mateo en el jardín?

sentences.spanish: Me mudé a una nueva casa el mes pasado. Es grande y bonita.
sentences.english: I moved into a new house last month. It's big and beautiful.

sentences.spanish: Mi casa tiene un jardín grande y un garaje para el carro.
sentences.english: My house has a big garden and a garage for the car.

sentences.spanish: En la entrada, hay un pasillo largo que lleva a la sala.
sentences.english: In the entrance, there is a long hallway that leads to the living room.

sentences.spanish: La sala tiene dos sofás y un cuadro en la pared.
sentences.english: The living room has two sofas and a painting on the wall.

sentences.spanish: En el dormitorio principal, hay una cama enorme y un armario grande.
sentences.english: In the main bedroom, there is a huge bed and a big closet.

sentences.spanish: La cocina tiene una estufa nueva y un lavaplatos moderno.
sentences.english: The kitchen has a new stove and a modern dishwasher.

sentences.spanish: Estoy muy feliz de vivir en mi nueva casa.
sentences.english: I am very happy to live in my new house.

sentences.spanish: El sábado es el día para limpiar la casa.
sentences.english: Saturday is the day to clean the house.

sentences.spanish: Primero, yo me levanto y hago la cama en mi dormitorio.
sentences.english: First, I get up and make the bed in my bedroom.

sentences.spanish: Luego, mi hermano y yo barremos el suelo del comedor.
sentences.english: Then, my brother and I sweep the dining room floor.

sentences.spanish: Mi padre pasa la aspiradora en la alfombra de la sala.
sentences.english: My father vacuums the living room rug.

sentences.spanish: Mi madre lava la ropa en la lavadora.
sentences.english: My mother washes the clothes in the washing machine.

sentences.spanish: Yo tiendo la ropa en el balcón para que se seque.
sentences.english: I hang the clothes on the balcony to dry.

sentences.spanish: Es mucho trabajo, pero la casa está limpia al final del día.
sentences.english: It's a lot of work, but the house is clean at the end of the day.

sentences.spanish: Mi noche empieza después de la cena. Mi hermana y yo lavamos los platos.
sentences.english: My evening starts after dinner. My sister and I wash the dishes.

sentences.spanish: Después, yo descanso en el sofá de la sala. Es mi lugar favorito.
sentences.english: Afterwards, I rest on the sofa in the living room. It's my favorite place.

sentences.spanish: Veo una película en la televisión que está en la pared.
sentences.english: I watch a movie on the television that is on the wall.

sentences.spanish: Mi madre se sienta en una silla y lee un libro.
sentences.english: My mother sits in a chair and reads a book.

sentences.spanish: A las diez, me voy a mi dormitorio. Cierro la puerta.
sentences.english: At ten, I go to my bedroom. I close the door.

sentences.spanish: Abro la ventana para que entre aire fresco.
sentences.english: I open the window so that fresh air comes in.

sentences.spanish: Me acuesto en mi cama, apago la lámpara y duermo.
sentences.english: I lie down in my bed, turn off the lamp, and sleep.

speaking.title: En la Casa
speaking.description: Preguntas y respuestas sobre las partes de la casa, los muebles y las tareas del hogar.

question.spanish: ¿Vives en una casa o en un apartamento?
question.english: Do you live in a house or an apartment?

answer.spanish: Yo vivo en un apartamento pequeño.
answer.english: I live in a small apartment.

question.english: What is in your bedroom?

answer.spanish: Hay una cama, un escritorio y una lámpara.
answer.english: There is a bed, a desk, and a lamp.

question.english: What is in the living room?

answer.spanish: Hay un sofá y un cuadro en la pared.
answer.english: There is a sofa and a painting on the wall.

question.english: Who makes the bed?

answer.spanish: Yo hago la cama todos los días.
answer.english: I make the bed every day.

question.spanish: ¿Barres el suelo o pasas la aspiradora?
question.english: Do you sweep the floor or vacuum?

answer.spanish: Yo paso la aspiradora en el suelo.
answer.english: I vacuum the floor.

question.english: Do you have a garden?

answer.spanish: Sí, mi casa tiene un jardín grande.
answer.english: Yes, my house has a big garden.

question.english: Is there a balcony in your house?

answer.spanish: Sí, hay un balcón pequeño en mi apartamento.
answer.english: Yes, there is a small balcony in my apartment.

question.english: Where do you wash the clothes?

answer.spanish: Yo lavo la ropa en la lavadora en el baño.
answer.english: I wash the clothes in the washing machine in the bathroom.

question.english: Does your kitchen have a dishwasher?

answer.spanish: Sí, la cocina tiene un lavaplatos.
answer.english: Yes, the kitchen has a dishwasher.

question.english: What do you do on the balcony?

answer.spanish: Yo descanso y leo un libro en el balcón.
answer.english: I rest and read a book on the balcony.

question.english: Where do you study in the house?

answer.spanish: Yo estudio en el escritorio en mi dormitorio.
answer.english: I study at the desk in my bedroom.

question.english: What is in your dining room?

answer.spanish: Hay una mesa y cuatro sillas.
answer.english: There is a table and four chairs.

question.english: Who sweeps the floor?

answer.spanish: Mi hermano barre el suelo del pasillo.
answer.english: My brother sweeps the hallway floor.

question.english: Do you open the window at night?

answer.spanish: Sí, abro la ventana para que entre aire fresco.
answer.english: Yes, I open the window so that fresh air can come in.

question.english: What do you do in the garden?

answer.spanish: Yo riego las plantas en el jardín.
answer.english: I water the plants in the garden.

question.english: Where is the mirror?

answer.spanish: El espejo está en el baño.
answer.english: The mirror is in the bathroom.

question.spanish: ¿Qué hace tu padre en la casa?
question.english: What does your father do in the house?

answer.spanish: Mi padre descansa en el sofá.
answer.english: My father rests on the sofa.

question.english: Is your house big or small?

answer.spanish: Mi casa es grande, pero el jardín es pequeño.
answer.english: My house is big, but the garden is small.

question.english: How many rooms does your house have?

answer.spanish: Mi casa tiene cinco cuartos.
answer.english: My house has five rooms.

question.spanish: ¿Qué hay en el suelo de tu sala?
question.english: What is on the floor of your living room?

answer.spanish: Hay una alfombra grande en el suelo.
answer.english: There is a big rug on the floor.
